meanings.definition: A person who is regarded as insignificant or incompetent.
meanings.sent1: The poor shmoe couldn't even tie his own shoes.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a shmoe and forget your umbrella on a rainy day.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy shmoe tripped over his own shoelaces.
meanings.sent4: He felt like a shmoe in a room full of experts.
meanings.sent5: The new employee was such a shmoe that he couldn't even operate the copy machine.

meanings.sent1: Imagine a regular shmoe trying to solve a complex math problem.
meanings.sent2: If any old shmoe can do it, so can you!
meanings.sent3: The average shmoe on the street wouldn't know what to do in this situation.
meanings.sent4: He's just a shmoe in the grand scheme of things.
meanings.sent5: Even a shmoe like me can understand this simple concept.

meanings.sent1: That shmoe fell for the oldest trick in the book.
meanings.sent2: Only a real shmoe would believe such a ridiculous story.
meanings.sent3: The poor shmoe thought he could fly if he flapped hard enough.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a shmoe after realizing she had been scammed.
meanings.sent5: He's such a shmoe, always getting himself into trouble with his silly ideas.
